fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25611].
  {panel}

Using standalone Crowd as an external directory (internal directory disabled):
* create a user (the 'original' user),
* add the user to some groups,
* delete the user,
* create a new user with same username,
* remove them from all groups,
* restart JIRA.

After JIRA restarts, the user will be in all the groups the original user was in, and it will be impossible to remove them from any of these groups.
fields.summary: Unable to modify group memberships for re-created users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25609].
  {panel}

In some cases the issue creator will not be same person who will verify the issue.

So we would like to request for another field called 'Verifier'.

When JIRA issue is created the 'Reporter' and 'Verifier' would be the same. 

But after the bug is set to resolved some other person should be able to pick up the issue and verify. (May be a mail could be sent to the creator)
fields.summary: Need new field 'Verifier' in the People region of the JIRA issue page
Hidden gadget causes JavaScript error in jquery.js

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25599].
  {panel}

In the "normal" Issue-Detail-Screen you just see the Issue-ID and the status of any linked Issue.
Our own customers and developers want to have the Issue-Icon before the Issue-ID so that they see whether the linked Issue is a Bug or a Feature or whatever.

Some of our Developers reviewed the Code and made a suggestion:

Before Jira 4.3 the file ../webapp/includes/snippets/issuelinksmall.jsp have to be edited
In Jira 4.3 the Linked-Issue-Section changed: webapp/includes/panels/issue/view_linking.jsp

In those Files there is a section {{<td class="issuekey">}} and after that the {{<a href="...">}}
Between those 2 Tags we added the following: {{<%@ include file="/includes/icons/type.jsp" %>}} which includes the Issue-Icon right before the Issue-ID.

I think that would be a nice improvement for all JIRA-Customers and Users. Maybe you will insert that simple code into your next Release?

Cheers
André
fields.summary: Show Issue-Icon for Linked-Issues in Issue-Detail-Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25596].
  {panel}

In JIRA v5.0 we are creating a separate API module for plugin developers to depend on to give more security that the plugin will remain compatible with future JIRA versions.

Plugins devs can change the dependency on "atlassian-jira" to "jira-api" in their maven pom.xml like so:
{code}
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.atlassian.jira</groupId>
            <artifactId>jira-api</artifactId>
            <version>${jira.version}</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>     
{code}

This issue is intended to gather feedback on what is included and what isn't included, and is of particular interest for JIRA v5.0 Early Access releases (milestones and betas).
fields.summary: Feedback for Java API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25595].
  {panel}

For some time now - at least since 2008 when I first drew this to Atlassian's attention - the configuration file entityengine.xml uses an incorrect JNDI binding for looking up UserTransaction.

The correct JNDI binding for applications to look up UserTransaction at runtime is:
   java:comp/UserTransaction.

See the JavaEE Specification EE6.8 page 153:
"JTA defines the UserTransaction interface that is used by applications to start, and commit or abort transactions. Application components get a UserTransaction object through a JNDI lookup using the name java:comp/UserTransaction or by requesting injection of a UserTransaction object."

Using the non-spec compliant binding of java:comp/env/UserTransaction probably works on Tomcat, but is not guaranteed to work on any other container. At this point let me declare my interest here as one of the core Jetty developers. That notwithstanding, surely it is in Atlassian's interests to be as container agnostic as possible? Especially on such a trivial issue.

Moreover, as JIRA is a well-known application no doubt many users would assume it uses industry best-practice and would copy this unfortunately incorrect and non-spec compliant configuration.

I again urge the JIRA developers to stick with spec compliance and simply fix the JNDI name configured in entityengine.xml.
fields.summary: entityengine.xml configuration for java:comp/env/UserTransaction is incorrect
Update Applinks-linker to work with JIRA 4.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25591].
  {panel}

In JIRA 4.4 the notification templates has changed(see [JRA-12640|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12640]) including the action performed on the sender (from field)(see attachment notification_jira_44.jpg), which was located on the notification subject in previous versions (see attachment notification_jira_43.jpg).

I raised this new feature to turn "_action_ at the sender ('from' field) optional", where the customer can choose which whether to enable this change or leave it, as it better fits to his business needs.

h3. Workaround for Subjects:
[JIRA Email Subjects Changed After Upgrade to 4.4.3|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Email+Subjects+Changed+After+Upgrade+to+4.4.3]

        at webwork.util.injection.ObjectFactory.instantiate(ObjectFactory.java:47)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.webwork.JiraActionFactory$JiraPluginActionFactory.instantiateAction(JiraActionFactory.java:476)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.webwork.JiraActionFactory$JiraPluginActionFactory.getActionImpl(JiraActionFactory.java:447)
        at webwork.action.factory.PrefixActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(PrefixActionFactoryProxy.java:109)

{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25567].
  {panel}

If you have issues with long summaries, then the order of sorting will not be respected.

h4. Steps to Reproduce.
# Create issues with a long summary.
{noformat}
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - A
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - B
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - C
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - Z
{noformat}
# Go to *Issue Navigator* and search for issues in the project where the issues above were created.
# Sort results by _Summary_.
# It can be seen that the order of sorting is not respected (see screen capture below):
!Issue Navigator.png!

h4. Extra information.
Tested with JIRA 4.2, 4.3 and 4.4.
h4.November, 22nd 2013 update
This is still happening on the latest version in OnDemand as of today (6.2-OD-03)
fields.summary: Sorting Mismatch when Dealing with Issues with Long Summary

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25559].

I want to change the information on our Jira application when a user can´t access the account and then click the Can't access your account? link to look as your implementation shown below:

Information on page https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa

If you can't access JIRA, fill in this form and an email will be sent to you with the details to access your account again.

When entering the username and a user does not exist I receive this message "A reset password link has been sent to you via email. You can follow that link and select a new password. If the email does not arrive, please contact your JIRA administrators."

How do I configure my Jira application to generate the above message instead of the default "No user with that username exists."

Please get back to me as soon as possible.

Best Regards,
Joakim Gahm

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25522].
  {panel}

According to jira documentation:

The "NOT IN" operator will not match a field that has no value (i.e. a field that is empty). For example, assignee not in (jack,jill) will only match issues that have an assignee and the assignee is not "jack" or "jill". To find issues that are assigned to someone other than "jack" or "jill" or are unassigned, you would need to type: assignee not in (jack,jill) or assignee is empty.


This is very frustrating, and besides that our users are not aware of this limitation (unless they dig in the doc which they never do) and thus complain that the query results are not correct.
I would also believe that a 'not in' result should return non-match AND empty values.
fields.summary: Allow 'NOT IN' operator to return empty values in JQL queries

There are many gadgets about atlassian gadget and 3rd gadget. But in our company it's hard to many people to use them.

1. They don't know what's gadget? However, In our company, thousands of people use JIRA and most of people have understand it.

2. They don't know how to use it? Moreover, they are puzzled about the gadget directory, Chart, JIRA, wallboard, etc. When people just want to use some component to track their team's user stories, they cannot to transfer their mind to gadget by this gadget directory.

So i suggest i can customize the gadget directory to pie, table, curve, histogram, etc. It's clear to JIRA user. They can config their JIRA as what they think. Like the image below.

!cat.png!
fields.summary: Gadget should be customize the gadget directory.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25493].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when [Exporting Search Results to Excel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Exporting+Search+Results+to+Microsoft+Excel], the user interface by default only allows a user to export a maximum of 1000 issues to an excel spreadsheet.

h3. Suggested Solution
For JIRA Server - allow admins to increase the limit
For JIRA Cloud - Consider slightly increasing the limit, provided the Cloud Server can handle the increase
 
h3. Workaround 

*For Behind the Firewall Customers*

Please consult the KB article at [Export More than 1000 Results to Excel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Export+More+Than+1000+Results+to+Excel]

*For Cloud Customers*
Please consult the KB article at [Cloud - Export More than 1000 issues to Excel from Issue Navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Export+More+than+1000+Issues+to+Excel+from+Issue+Navigator+in+JIRA+Cloud]
fields.summary: Export to Excel is limited to a maximum of 1000 issues

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25465].
  {panel}

The default translation strings for JIRA 4.4 now live in

*/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/JiraWebActionSupport.properties*

and as previously the jars were located in
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/

e.g. ./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/jira-lang-en_US-4.4.jar


Can we go ahead and update our documentation on [Customizing Text|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Customizing+Text] to reflect this information?

Thanks!

With best regards, 

Marian Finch
Atlassian Support - San Francisco
fields.summary: Customizing Text Doc Needs Updating

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25464].
  {panel}

I worked with a customer who was having issues following our documentation on Configuring Email Notifications specifically in regards to Configuring a Project's Email Address.

I was wondering if the following information could be added to the doc? Here is something along the lines of the information I want to add:

Please note that Gmail will override the outgoing email address unless it's an authorized address.  If you access Gmail through a POP or IMAP email client (e.g. Outlook) and would like to send messages with a custom "from" address, you have two options. We recommend that you configure your email client with two outgoing SMTP servers, one for Gmail and one for your other address. Or, you can use Gmail's outbound servers with a different "from" address. If you've already configured the alternate address, your message will be sent from:otheraddress@domain.com, sender:username@gmail.com, regardless of which custom from configuration you chose.

The custom 'From:' feature works only if you already own the account linker to the alternate address. To send mail with a different Gmail username, you must first sign up for that address.
fields.summary: Update Email Documentation

Currenntly the list has some additional comments

Francis

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25449].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

* Create a new workflow scheme
* Add all issue types to the given workflow scheme
* From the "Edit workflows page" reached from that workflows scheme, it is still possible to click "Assign a workflow to an issue type for this scheme.", which will show up with a non-existent issue type for assigning to workflows.
fields.summary: When all issue types are assigned to a workflow scheme, its still possible to enter the assign issue type to workflow scheme page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25448].
  {panel}

# Restore [^data.zip]
# Go to the fields tab on the "TST" project.

!long_field_name.png!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25445].
  {panel}

The context calculation tries to imply which project/issue type combinations are possible for a particular query. For example, {{project = JRA}} generates the context (JRA,*) (i.e. Project = JRA with any issue types). We use this on the issue navigator to only display custom fields in context (e.g. a custom field that is only visible in the CONF project will not have its column renderered) and doesItFit(TM) calculation. The "was" clause does not generate the right context.

# Restore [^data.zip].
# Run the query {{status = monkey}}. Notice that the "Monkey Custom Field" is displayed. This is because the context for this query is (MKY, *) as the status monkey only exists in the Monkey project.
# (DEFECT) Run the query {{status was monkey}}. Notice that the "Monkey Custom Field" is *NOT* displayed. This is because the context for this query is calculated as (*, *). The context for this query should also be (MKY, *).
fields.summary: Context calculation for was clauses is broken.
JQL autocomplete does not suggest list operand for the DURING condition.

Steps:
1. Login to JIRA. Click on "Add gadget" on dashboard and add "activity stream" gadget from confluence.
2. Add the gadget to the dashboard.
3. Configure the dashboard, user can see all update to the selected space.
4. Try adding a comment to any entry.

Result:
1. User gets a The resource https://qa-cac.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/streamscomments, cannot be found.
2. Anonymous user can post comment on qa-cac instance.
fields.summary: Posting comment is failing for confluence gadget added in JIRA dashboard.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25436].
  {panel}

Based on the docs, I used issue.key as a velocity parameter on the web-fragment, assuming that the Issue object would be in the velocity context under "issue". This works on the view issue page. Unfortunately, when the issue operation is rendered on the issue navigator, the issue parameter isn't in the velocity context - only the issueId parameter is present.

I'd expect both of these to contain the same velocity parameters when rendering. If they don't, then the documentation should be updated so developers know what parameters they can rely on here.

See getIssueOperations() in IssueNavigator for where the IssueOperations get their velocity parameters (well, velocity parameter) in the issue nav.

Caused https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BON-18
fields.summary: Velocity context present for issue operation web items doesn't contain "issue" when rendered in the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25429].
  {panel}

Statuses in a visual workflow show *Step Name (id)* values as opposed to *Linked Status* values.

Since the *Step Name (id)* value is really only shown in the Steps Editor (and nowhere else throughout the JIRA UI), visual workflows should be reflecting *Linked Status* values instead.

By implementing this fix, then whenever the JIRA (project) administrator edits the name of a status in the VWD's status editor, the name change should be reflected in the visual workflow (and for ordinary JIRA users, the workflow view of JIRA issues which use that workflow).

Bear in mind that changing a status' name in the VMD affects all other workflows that use the same status. This is considered expected behaviour. To create a status that's workflow-specific, the JIRA (project) administrator would need to create a completely new status (i.e. *Linked Status*) to use in the workflow.
fields.summary: Statuses in a visual workflow show 'Step Name (id)' values as opposed to 'Linked Status' values.

fields.description:
I'd like the now() operator to accept an increment like the other date functions (startOfDay(), endOfWeek(), etc.)

The alternate syntax would be:
now("inc")
where inc is an optional increment of (+/-)nn(y|M|w|d|h|m)

For example, this could allow one to create a scheduled filter to send them new issues matching a specific query every hour:

... affectsVersion = "4.4" and created >= now("-1h")

We were looking for this kind of functionality for users who only want to be notified of new issues matching certain criteria. The notification schemes and component watchers didn't provide the functionality we were looking for.
fields.summary: As a Jira user I would like the now() search function to support time increment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25417].
  {panel}

We've had situations where some project roles (i.e., such as Project Manager's) that do not wish to receive automatic e-mail notifications when their issues are updated, created, etc. while others in the same role/group do.  Since subscriptions can only be created for personal use or group(s) their still is not a way to create some form of subscription for those who do or do not wish to receive notifications.  And even if there was the system would send the results of the subscription to all in the group vice just the assignee.  Suggest implementing one of two systems.

#1) Allow each person to have the option on their profile to either 'receive' or 'not receive' automated notifications from JIRA.  This scheme involves just notifications, not subscriptions. 

#2) Add functionality within the subscription feature to allow adding project roles and/or individuals to the subscription.  You can setup a group with only one individual now but the extra steps seem totally needless to achieve the same results.  Moreover, with this add an additional option of sending the subscription only to those who are affected (i.e., the assignee, reporter, project, or a configurable paradigm setup by the JIRA Administrator).

Both the notification schema and subscription functionality is a power feature to help keep on top of things.  Adding one or both of these recommendations would simply make this a much more powerful capability.
fields.summary: Additional Functionality for Automated JIRA Notifications
ability to set User Properties custom field as statistic type for pie chart or other charting plugin

	at java.lang.Enum.valueOf(Enum.java:196)
	at com.atlassian.streams.api.StreamsFilterType$Operator.valueOf(StreamsFilterType.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.streams.internal.ActivityRequestImpl$Builder$FilterParser.apply(ActivityRequestImpl.java:231)
	at com.atlassian.streams.internal.ActivityRequestImpl$Builder$FilterParser.apply(ActivityRequestImpl.java:220)
	at com.atlassian.streams.api.common.Fold.foldl(Fold.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.streams.internal.ActivityRequestImpl$Builder.parseFilters(ActivityRequestImpl.java:217)
	at com.atlassian.streams.internal.ActivityRequestImpl$Builder.parseStandardFilters(ActivityRequestImpl.java:209)
	at com.atlassian.streams.internal.ActivityRequestImpl$Builder.build(ActivityRequestImpl.java:181)
	at com.atlassian.streams.internal.FeedBuilder$ToFeedCallable$1.call(FeedBuilder.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.streams.internal.FeedBuilder$ToFeedCallable$1.call(FeedBuilder.java:86)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:441)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LimitedExecutor$Runner.run(LimitedExecutor.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.executor.ThreadLocalDelegateRunnable.run(ThreadLocalDelegateRunnable.java:34)

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)

To reproduce:
- Access JIRA using Mozilla FireFox
- Go to a project summary page
- Subscribe the project activity stream RSS feeds
- Subscribe the feed using Microsoft Outlook

  {panel}

Hi,

A customer complained that Text gadget displays blank screen when HTML code exceeds a number of lines in Internet Explorer.

Steps to reproduce:
* Add a Text gadget.
* Add few lines (2-3) of HTML code to it
* Gadget displays properly
* Add more lines of HTML code
* Gadget displays properly
* Refresh the page
* Dashboard becomes blank..

It works fine in Chrome and IE8.
On IE7 it gives the page(attached).
 
Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Text gadget displays blank screen when HTML code exceeds a number of lines in Internet Explorer.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25386].
  {panel}

Would like a capability to group my Favorite Filters into Folders to better manage them by a release version, group, etc.. 
So when I display my Favorite Filters on the Dashboard instead of seeing 25 different filters I can see "Favorite Filter Folders" 
(when I click on Folder name I then see a list of similar filters in) and maybe one or two filters by themselves that I didn't assign to a folder.

EXAMPLE of a possible Folder structure with filters:
Folder 1 (Release v1.0)
   Filter 1
   Filter 2
   Filter 3
   Filter 4
Folder 2 (Release v2.0)
   Filter 1
   Filter 2
   Filter 3
Folder 3 (Release v2.1)
   Filter 1
Folder 4 (Workflow Statuses)
   CREATED
   CCB 
   DEV_QUEUE
   ASSIGNED
   WORKING
   BUILD_READY
   TEST_READY
   VERIFIED
Filter ABCDEF
Filter XYZ
fields.summary: Add a capability to group my Favorite Filters into Folders

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25371].
  {panel}

As a Jira user I find the keyboard shortcuts feature extremely useful. I use my keyboard a lot, and not needing the mouse for navigating features, etc. is pretty useful.

However, there is one annoying thing: assuming I want (like any sane developer) to repeatedly watch my assigned tickets, I need to:
 - g + d: to go to the dashboard
 - click on the "assigned to me" filter
 - j/k: to find the desired issue
 - do something with the issue ('.' for choosing actions, etc).

The entire cycle could have been done from the keyboard if it wasn't for the 'click' stage :-(

It would be great to have a way to define custom shortcuts for specific filters, or perhaps a way to navigate the dashboard widgets and enter them through the keyboard.

Thanks in advance,

Rotem
fields.summary: Add keyboard shortcuts to filters (or maybe to dashboard widgets in general)
JqlClauseBuilder.orderBy().issueId() actually orders by issue key
